Why standest thou afar off, O LORD? <FI>why<Fi> hidest thou <FI>thyself<Fi> in times of trouble?
The wicked in <FI>his<Fi> pride doth persecute the poor: let them be taken in the devices that they have imagined.<RF>The wicked…: Heb. In the pride of the wicked he doth persecute<Rf>

For the wicked boasteth of his heart's desire, and blesseth the covetous, <FI>whom<Fi> the LORD abhorreth.<RF>heart's: Heb. soul's<Rf><RF>blesseth…: or, the covetous blesseth himself, he abhorreth the LORD<Rf>
The wicked, through the pride of his countenance, will not seek <FI>after God<Fi>: God <FI>is<Fi> not in all his thoughts.<RF>God is…: or, all his thoughts are, There is no God<Rf>
His ways are always grievous; thy judgments <FI>are<Fi> far above out of his sight: <FI>as for<Fi> all his enemies, he puffeth at them.
He hath said in his heart, I shall not be moved: for <FI>I shall<Fi> never <FI>be<Fi> in adversity.<RF>never: Heb. unto generation and generation<Rf>
His mouth is full of cursing and deceit and fraud: under his tongue <FI>is<Fi> mischief and vanity.<RF>deceit: Heb. deceits<Rf><RF>vanity: or, iniquity<Rf>
He sitteth in the lurking places of the villages: in the secret places doth he murder the innocent: his eyes are privily set against the poor.<RF>are…: Heb. hide themselves<Rf>
He lieth in wait secretly as a lion in his den: he lieth in wait to catch the poor: he doth catch the poor, when he draweth him into his net.<RF>secretly: Heb. in the secret places<Rf>
He croucheth, <FI>and<Fi> humbleth himself, that the poor may fall by his strong ones.<RF>He…: Heb. He breaketh himself<Rf><RF>by…: or, into his strong parts<Rf>
He hath said in his heart, God hath forgotten: he hideth his face; he will never see <FI>it<Fi>.<CM>
Arise, O LORD; O God, lift up thine hand: forget not the humble.<RF>humble: or, afflicted<Rf>
Wherefore doth the wicked contemn God? he hath said in his heart, Thou wilt not require <FI>it<Fi>.

Thou hast seen <FI>it<Fi>; for thou beholdest mischief and spite, to requite <FI>it<Fi> with thy hand: the poor committeth himself unto thee; thou art the helper of the fatherless.<RF>committeth: Heb. leaveth<Rf>
Break thou the arm of the wicked and the evil <FI>man<Fi>: seek out his wickedness <FI>till<Fi> thou find none.
The LORD <FI>is<Fi> King for ever and ever: the heathen are perished out of his land.
LORD, thou hast heard the desire of the humble: thou wilt prepare their heart, thou wilt cause thine ear to hear:<RF>prepare: or, establish<Rf>
To judge the fatherless and the oppressed, that the man of the earth may no more oppress.<RF>oppress: or, terrify<Rf><CM>
